titleStmt.title: 1843 June 30, To CMS: Mr William Colenso’s Report of Waimate, June 30/43.

sourceDesc.p: encoded into TEI by Melissa Bryant, 23.10.15

front.p: To CMS: Mr William Colenso’s Report of Waimate, June 30/43.

body.p: During the last six months I have been employed as follows.

When at Paihia, in reading and correcting proof sheets of Archdeacon Williams’ Dictionary, Mixing and dispensing medicines to Natives, conversing with them &c. &c. On Sundays I have as usual visited the natives at the different villages.

On the 5th. of January I left Paihia for the Thames and returned on the 27th. of that month. On the 27th. March I left Paihia on a visit to the natives living on the shores of Wangarei Bay and returned on the 8th. April.
On the 17th. I left Paihia again for the Thames where I was married and on the 7th. May returned to Paihia with Mrs. Colenso.

On the 12th. of this month (June) I left Paihia to reside as a student and candidate for Holy Orders at St. John’s College, Waimate, where I am now studying under the direction of his lordship the Bishop of New Zealand. On the 1st. Jan. 1843 I delivered up the charge of the Printing Office and Printing Stores to Mr. Telford as desired by the N. District Committee.
